Job DescriptionPRINCIPAL PRODUCT MANAGERWe’re the Kira team at Litera! We’ve built contract review software that uses the best combination of machine learning, workflow and great user experience to help lawyers to truly know what’s in their contracts and documents in order to deliver high quality deliverables during corporate transactions. We’re deliberate in our decision making, clear on our mission and – most importantly – passionate about pairing the power of human know- how with a powerful product.We’re a remote first team with many of our team members in the eastern time zone, but we’re a global workforce. From building trusted partnerships with our clients to delivering an employee experience that is second to none, our people are at the center of all that we do.We’re looking for a Principal Product Manager who is not afraid to lead and to make the hard decisions required to deliver software that provides an excellent world-class experience. We strive to design solutions that our customers and users didn’t even know were possible.You will work with customers to uncover and document important, unmet needs, and work with one or more cross functional teams to advance our software. You collaborate with our Design and Technology teams to bring new features to market. This role is responsible for the complete product lifecycle including product discovery, collaboratively creating and executing on the roadmap, launching new features with Marketing, Sales and Support, including planning communicating new features to users and gathering feedback to refine what’s been released.A DAY IN THE LIFEThe Customer – Principal Product Managers are responsible for clearly articulating who our customers are and priorities across personas. Direct customer engagement in meetings to discuss needs and concerns as well as inform on roadmap intentions are critical for properly prioritizing our engineering efforts. Skilled at tracking and understanding customer data is critical.The Competition – Principal Product Managers need to be the expert on what the competition is doing as well as where the market is heading from a trends perspective. A great Product Manager is responsible for a deep understanding of how we differentiate, but not just for difference's sake, but to support our position in the market.The Requirements – Define engineering efforts through authoring Epics and Stories that clearly define WHO the feature or experience is for, written in the user voice and the WHY this effort is value. Clear prioritization is critical with a rolling monthly updated roadmap modified and refreshed based on the latest data and customer information.The Story, The Vision – Everyone from engineering, QA, user experience, marketing etc need to know what story we are trying to tell with the work we are doing. Not the “What” but the “Why” it matters. A coherent vision told as a story in the user voice is critical for aligning all disciplines to the same goal.The Roadmap – What is coming next? When is it coming? You will drive the beating heart of the Product Development organization being updated every month with latest adjustment of prioritization based on customer data, engineering team status and latest strategic priorities. Short term tactical delivery-focused versions worked monthly with longer term versions focused on strategic approach to winning in the market. This role will have a specific focus on Kira’s path forward as AI technologies continue to advance.The User Experience – Working closely with the Litera Design team to ensure the user experience is a first-class citizen in our product development efforts. While the Product Manager does not own the design direction in isolation but must be passionate about the end user experience and a champion working closely with Design from the discovery to sketch to iteration to delivery ensuring place in the roadmap.The End-To-End – The Product Manager’s job does not stop with shepherding the development of the product, on the contrary. Ensuring the Go-To-Market teams are armed to tell the right story and support our customers with confidence is still the responsibility of the Product Manager.ROLE PROGRESSIONWithin 1 month, you will:Complete new hire onboarding, including eLearning courses, instructor-led training, and moreTrain on Litera’s core values and get an overview of our solutionsMeet team members and review goals, initiatives, and specific objectivesMeet with key stakeholders across the businessReview and understand core market problems, value propositions, and features of the productLearn our current product roadmapLearn the product roadmap creation, development and release processes.Talk to and learn from our customersWithin 3 months, you will:Contribute to our research and development processUnderstand your product’s marketplace, personas, buyers, buying dynamics, and key user workflowsDig into the evolving world of Generative AI and work with the teams to continue to plot our path forwardCommunicate with customers and prospects to listen and understand the voice of the customer.Drive conversations about where product should be going, encouraging debate and critiqueContribute to a product release by validating and testing assumptionsAnalyze your product’s past releases to identify focuses, compromises, and areas for improvementEvaluate new feature and enhancement requestsBecome an autonomous member of the product team and independently plan work to meet deadlinesPresent your roadmap themes, goals and supporting initiatives to the teamWithin 6 months, you will:Work with the Product, Development, UX, Legal Knowledge Engineering and product marketing to deliver value using new Generative AI technologiesServe as a subject matter expert for how users perform their jobsInnovate and advocate for new strategies and product directionKnow why Litera is winning and losing in the market. Drive changes to the product that will create improvement.About YouYou have excellent communication skills, written and verbal, with the ability to take complex business requirements and translate them to a form that’s widely understandableYou are curious and passionate about solving real user problems by finding the right AI technologyA great team has a diverse set of skills, you are the person who is passionate about the details of the technology.You are able to articulate vision but also comfortable getting into the technical weeds and rolling around in the data with the team.You have attained a bachelor’s degree or higher in Computer Science, Software Engineering or a similar fieldsYou can think through and advise about how small changes or requests can have strategic impacts across all levels of the businessYou’re comfortable speaking with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders and able to seek out conversations and discussions yourselfYou are self-motivated with curiosity about how our customers work, and passionate about delivering great user experiencesYou’re comfortable balancing competing priorities while working with and solving problems for customers.You don’t shy away from awkward situations or being clear when you can’t commit to somethingYou stand out in your dedication to deliver value to users and help them achieve their goals.What Sets us Apart?Cool AI technology that helps solve significant user problems.Working on a product that our customers loveWork with a team that has a proven track recordOur company growth will challenge, and encourage you to broaden your skillsGenerous allocation of paid time off, and flexible work hoursAvailable merit-based cash bonus planMany opportunities for rewards and recognitionLitera is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
